text:
Question 42) Text I The president of the country's largest circulation newspaper also highlighted the economic advances obtained in those twenty years, but, justifying their adherence to the military in 1964, made clear his belief that the intervention had been essential for the maintenance of democracy.
Text II can nothing to be placed in compensation to the loss of individual freedoms. There is nothing good when accepting an authoritarian solution.
Although they emphasize the defense of democracy, the visions of the 1964 political-military movement differ by focusing, respectively:
A) State reasons - popular sovereignty.
B) Ordination of the nation - religious prerogatives.
C) Imposition of the Armed Forces - social duties.
D) Standardization of the Judiciary - Moral Rules.
E) contestation of the government system - cultural traditions.
